body:
I think this should be fairly easy.

Instead of instructing the users to paste the token from a URL, we'll tell them to use `rclone authorize` instead.

I've had a go at this - can you give it a test and see if you think it is OK?

[v1.58.0-beta.6000.dc7e3ea1e.fix-6000-drive-oauth](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6000-drive-oauth/v1.58.0-beta.6000.dc7e3ea1e.fix-6000-drive-oauth/) on branch [fix-6000-drive-oauth](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6000-drive-oauth) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

rename.to: Change Google Remote OAuth - OOB Method has been deprecated.

body:
Worked fine.

Minor nitpick, perhaps we should remove this line at least for the affected backends?

```
Make sure your Redirect URL is set to "urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob" in your custom config
```

I'm guessing you didn't use the beta for `rclone authorize` as it worked when I tried it

    2022/02/18 13:47:53 NOTICE: Make sure your Redirect URL is set to "http://127.0.0.1:53682/" in your custom config.

Does this mean people are going to have to reconfigure their Oauth clients? I'm guessing not since we've been using this flow for the non remote oauth. We don't seem to mention the redirect URL in https://rclone.org/drive/#making-your-own-client-id though.

Can't seem to get to the console credentials at the moment to check but in the other cloud providers they have a whitelist of redirect URLs.

> I'm guessing you didn't use the beta for rclone authorize as it worked when I tried it

Yeah, you are right. Worked fine when I used authorize with the beta.

> they have a whitelist of redirect URLs.

This seems to be required only when creating credentials for a Web App. or similar. Desktop App Credentials don't seem to require it yet but that may change in the future if they continue with such security changes.

Ah, that makes sense as the redirect URL would have to be 127.0.0.1 based so they probably just allow all of those.

This page seems to confirm that: https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/native-app#redirect-uri_loopback

Though the docs here https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/native-app#request-parameter-redirect_uri say for redirect_url

> The value must exactly match one of the authorized redirect redirect URIs for the OAuth 2.0 client, which you configured in your client's API Console [Credentials page](https://console.developers.google.com/apis/credentials). If this value doesn't match an authorized URI, you will get a redirect_uri_mismatch error.

Google docs wouldn't be what they are if they weren't contradicting each other within the same page :laughing:


Anyway, looks like the deprecation is addressed with this change so I will go ahead and close this issue.

Probably a good idea to get a release with this out as soon as possible so it has time to reach all the package managers and various tools that depend on rclone.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.58

Next week I'm going to see what things we need to do for the 1.58 release and try to get it back on track.

@ncw apologies for commenting on a closed item, should I create a new issue?

The latest 1.58 beta release does not resolve this for me

Headless server `rclone version`
rclone v1.58.0-beta.6018.ec72432ce
- os/version: debian 10.11 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.10.0-0.bpo.9-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.17.7
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none

Machine with web browser `rclone version`
rclone v1.58.0-beta.6018.ec72432ce
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro N 21H1 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.19043.1526 (x86_64)
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: 386
- go/version: go1.17.7
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: cmount

I've tried with Desktop App, Limited Input and Web App for the client credentials. The Limited Input credentials did not work at all. Desktop App and Web App credentials let me select the account to auth with, before redirecting to a generic error screen with 

```
Something went wrong
Sorry, something went wrong there. Try again.
```

with a 'next' button that redirects to

```
400. That‚Äôs an error.
The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That‚Äôs all we know.
```

Let me know if there's more info that you need.

It's working fine for me on the latest beta with a freshly created set of credentials.

You should probably create a forum thread about your problem in case it's something simple that got missed rather than an issue with rclone itself.

@darthShadow while reproducing the issue for the forum, it's resolved itself and working now - no idea what's changed other than a reboot overnight!

Thanks for pointing me to the forum üëç

FYI, these steps no longer work. I get an error message as follow:
```
Error 400: invalid_request

You can't sign in to this app because it doesn't comply with Google's OAuth 2.0 policy for keeping apps secure.

You can let the app developer know that this app doesn't comply with one or more Google validation rules.
Request Details
The content in this section has been provided by the app developer. This content has not been reviewed or verified by Google.
If you‚Äôre the app developer, make sure that these request details comply with Google policies.
redirect_uri: urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob
```

I'm attempting to mount gdrive on a **headless server** and so am opening the url on my laptop while ssh'd into the server.

You need to use the beta to get it working since there's no publicly available release with this patch.

Please use the [forum](https://forum.rclone.org) if you still have issues even after using the beta version.
The fix for this will be release in 1.58 which will hopefully be today as all the blockers are now fixed.
